qas.question: In which language was the Quran first translated?
Which work did scribes from Khorasan translate in the 10th century?
Whose student wrote a Persian tafsir of the Quran in the 11th century?
Who wrote a Persian translation of the Quran in the 12th century?
To which dynasty did the king who commissioned the first translation of Quranic texts belong?
In which language was the Quran last translated?
Which work did scribes from Khorasan translate in the 11th century?
Whose student wrote a Persian tafsir of the Quran in the 10th century?
Who wrote a Persian translation of the Quran in the 11th century?
To which dynasty did the king who commissioned the last translation of Quranic texts belong?

context: The first fully attested complete translations of the Quran were done between the 10th and 12th centuries in <a0_0>Persian<a0_0/>. The <a4_0><b9_0>Samanid<b9_0/><a4_0/> king, Mansur I (961-976), ordered a group of scholars from Khorasan to translate the <a1_0><b6_0>Tafsir al-Tabari<b6_0/><a1_0/>, originally in Arabic, into <b5_0>Persian<b5_0/>. Later in the 11th century, one of the students of <a2_0><b7_0>Abu Mansur Abdullah al-Ansari<b7_0/><a2_0/> wrote a complete tafsir of the Quran in Persian. In the 12th century, <a3_0><b8_0>Najm al-Din Abu Hafs al-Nasafi<b8_0/><a3_0/> translated the Quran into Persian. The manuscripts of all three books have survived and have been published several times.[citation needed]
